Mohit Yadav

Bio

I am a PhD Candidate at CICS, University of Massachusetts Amherst. My research examines learning problems with an emphasis on their foundations and applications. In particular, my research interests include Gaussian processes and NLP, focusing on fast inference for Gaussian processes and deep learning for NLP.

Currently, my advisors are Prof. Daniel Sheldon and Prof. Cameron Musco. Previously, I was a research assistant for Prof. Andrew McCAllum, a research engineer for TCS research, and a bachelor student at Indian Institute of Technology, Mandi.
